title: Generic Neighborhood Spaces
content: Any neighborhood space is an open set topology and any open set topology is a neighborhood space. Seifert and Threlfall define a generic neighborhood space which is a superset of what is now generally used and related concepts and the following will show that those definitions apply to elements of ` Top ` . Seifert and Threlfall do not allow neighborhood spaces on the empty set while ~ sn0top is an example of a topology with an empty base set. This divergence is unlikely to pose serious problems.

blocks.name: gneispa
blocks.content: Each point ` p ` of the neighborhood space has at least one neighborhood; each neighborhood of ` p ` contains ` p ` . Axiom A of Seifert and Threlfall. (Contributed by RP, 5-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm gneispa(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wral(s0, c1, wa(wne(cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), emptycls), wral(s1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cuni(c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  ralrimiv(s0, c1, wcel(c0, ctop), wa(wne(cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), emptycls), wral(s1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  ex(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wa(wne(cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), emptycls), wral(s1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  jca(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wne(cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), emptycls), wral(s1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  ne0d(cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), c1, wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1)))
  imp(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0)))))
  syl5ib(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(c1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0)))), wss(csn(cv(s0)), c1))
  snssi(cv(s0), c1)
  tpnei(c0, csn(cv(s0)), c1)
  ralrimiv(s1, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0))), wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  3expia(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(cv(s0)))), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  elnei(c0, cv(s0), c1, cv(s1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, ctop)
  diff.ctop.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s1, wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(cv(s0), c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, ctop)
  diff.ctop.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s0), c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm gneispa(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Top → ∀(s0 ∈ c1,(((nei ` c0)` { s0 })≠ ∅ ∧ ∀(s1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), s0 ∈ s1))))
  ⊣ c1 = ⋃ c0
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  ralrimiv(s0, c1, c0 ∈ Top, (((nei ` c0)` { s0 })≠ ∅ ∧ ∀(s1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), s0 ∈ s1)))
  ex(c0 ∈ Top, s0 ∈ c1, (((nei ` c0)` { s0 })≠ ∅ ∧ ∀(s1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), s0 ∈ s1)))
  jca((c0 ∈ Top ∧ s0 ∈ c1), ((nei ` c0)` { s0 })≠ ∅, ∀(s1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), s0 ∈ s1))
  ne0d(((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), c1, (c0 ∈ Top ∧ s0 ∈ c1))
  imp(c0 ∈ Top, s0 ∈ c1, c1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }))
  syl5ib(c0 ∈ Top, s0 ∈ c1, c1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), { s0 } ⊆ c1)
  snssi(s0, c1)
  tpnei(c0, { s0 }, c1)
  ralrimiv(s1, ((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), (c0 ∈ Top ∧ s0 ∈ c1), s0 ∈ s1)
  3expia(c0 ∈ Top, s0 ∈ c1, s1 ∈((nei ` c0)` { s0 }), s0 ∈ s1)
  elnei(c0, s0, c1, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, ctop)
  diff.ctop.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s1, c0 ∈ Top, s0 ∈ c1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, ctop)
  diff.ctop.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, s0, c1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: gneispb
blocks.content: Given a neighborhood ` N ` of ` P ` , each subset of the neighborhood space containing this neighborhood is also a neighborhood of ` P ` . Axiom B of Seifert and Threlfall. (Contributed by RP, 5-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm gneispb(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wral(s0, cpw(c2), wi(wss(c3, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1))))))
  -| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  ralrimiv(s0, cpw(c2), w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wi(wss(c3, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))))
  exp31(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c2)), wss(c3, cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1))))
  syl12anc(wa(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c2))), wss(c3, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s0), cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1))), wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wss(c3, cv(s0)), wss(cv(s0), c2))
  ad2antrr(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c2)), wss(c3, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))))
  3simpb(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1))))
  simpr(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c2))), wss(c3, cv(s0)))
  elpwid(cv(s0), c2, wa(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c2))), wss(c3, cv(s0))))
  simplr(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))), wcel(cv(s0), cpw(c2)), wss(c3, cv(s0)))
  ssnei2(c0, c3, csn(c1), cv(s0), c2)
  diff.w3a.s(s0, wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1))))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, ctop)
  diff.ctop.s(s0)

  diff.wcel.s(s0, c3, cfv(cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cfv(cnei, c0), csn(c1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cnei, c0)
  diff.cnei.s(s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, c1)

thm gneispb(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))→ ∀(s0 ∈ P(c2),(c3 ⊆ s0 → s0 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))))
  ⊣ c2 = ⋃ c0
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  ralrimiv(s0, P(c2), (c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })), (c3 ⊆ s0 → s0 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })))
  exp31((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })), s0 ∈ P(c2), c3 ⊆ s0, s0 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))
  syl12anc((((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))∧ s0 ∈ P(c2))∧ c3 ⊆ s0), s0 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }), (c0 ∈ Top ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })), c3 ⊆ s0, s0 ⊆ c2)
  ad2antrr((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })), s0 ∈ P(c2), c3 ⊆ s0, (c0 ∈ Top ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })))
  3simpb(c0 ∈ Top, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))
  simpr(((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))∧ s0 ∈ P(c2)), c3 ⊆ s0)
  elpwid(s0, c2, (((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))∧ s0 ∈ P(c2))∧ c3 ⊆ s0))
  simplr((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 })), s0 ∈ P(c2), c3 ⊆ s0)
  ssnei2(c0, c3, { c1 }, s0, c2)
  diff.w3a.s(s0, c0 ∈ Top, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, ctop)
  diff.ctop.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c3, ((nei ` c0)` { c1 }))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, (nei ` c0), { c1 })
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cnei, c0)
  diff.cnei.s(s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, c1)
}

blocks.name: gneispacef
blocks.content: A generic neighborhood space is a function with a range that is a subset of the powerset of the powerset of its domain. (Contributed by RP, 15-Apr-2021.)
blocks.origin:
